posts.post_content:
Uncle Dick says you can't sell cards for 7% of book value ... I say phooey.


Here are six 1912 T202 triple fiolder at or below that price:

     Magee/Dooin/Donlin out at first – fair, taped together, creases – $25

     Magee/Moran/Bush just misses Austin – good, creases, irregular cut – $30

     Becker/Devore/Just before battle (with HOFer McGraw) – good, creases - $35

     Archer/Rowan/Chance beats out a hit – fair, small paper loss on back, creases – $30

     Jones/Delahanty/Jim Delahanty at bat – good, creases – SOLD

     Stanage/Mullin/A wide throw saves Crawford (with HOFer crawford)– good, creases – SOLD

See detailed condition in scans.  Let me know if you have any questions.

Cheers,
Patrick

A few more:

Payne/white/close at the plate (with Walsh HOFer) – fair, taped, creases – $35

Carrigan/Wagner/Carrigans blcoks – fair, smll paper loss on back, creases – SOLD

Huggins (HOFer)/Evans/Sullivan Puts up a high one – fair, very small spot paper loss, tear – SOLD

Kling/Steinfeldt/Lobert almost caught – fair, creases – $25

Thomas/Bender (HOFer)/Chief Bender waiting for a good one (HOFer) – good, small sots paper loss on front – $SOLD

Jennings(HOFer)/Mcgraw(HOFer)/Just before the battle (with HOFer) – poor/fair, corner damage – $45

Clarke (HOFer)/Gibson/Chase dives into third – poor/fair, ripped corner, tear – $35

Payne/white/close at the plate – good (looks better), small spot of paper loss on back – $35

Needham/Richie/McConnell caught – fair, bad edge/corner – $30

Stovall/Austin/Stahl Safe – poor cut in three, double print on Stovall/Austin – $40

Baker/Collins/Collins easily safe – poor cut in three, tap, Collins/baker red back, Collins easily safe in black – $50

Also have three low grade single panels:

Doyle - $5
Lobert - $5
Mcintire - $5

Or all three for $10

Cheers,
Patrick
